{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3575005,"name":"Anderson Hall","username":"Xactlysharp","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/xactlysharp/{size}/186572_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T15:48:26.181Z","cooked":"

Our team mounted an Everybot climber to our robot recently, driven by a linear ball-screw (see image below).
We tested it last night, and unfortunately, we are barely not able to climb.
If we fully retract the ball-screw when engaged with the cage, 3 of our wheels can get off the ground, because our CG is far enough off from the pivot point to have the robot tilt backwards.
We do not have much extra weight allocation, but are working to add ballast to see if that will help with our CG
We also noticed that our robot can easily swing and tilt while climbed; i.e we can barely touch the robot and it’ll get off the ground, but we have wheels that slightly drag.

We also noticed that the chain will hit our coral manipulator, circled in blue, which we don’t want to happen

Any ideas?

20250330_2243121848×1475 337 KB

20250330_2243141848×4000 878 KB

I can take more photos or videos if needed.
